201.title: A Fog-Shrouded Trail
201.description:
You are on a fog-shrouded trail which runs up the side of this dark
mountain.  The ground is wet and muddy with melted snow, and the path
which should lead to the Miden'nir disappears amongst the mist and the
trees.  There is nothing for you to do but follow the trail that twists
up towards the broken, snow-covered heights of the mountain range.
An old stone tablet with inscriptions stands beside a bush in the
corner.

up.description: The Haunted Pine Forest lies above.

extras.description:
You may obtain a free copy of Emerald Forest from any of the authors below.
No part of this area may be modified or transmitted, in any form known to
mankind without the formal consent of the author(s). You may however
modify it so as to render it compatible with the running of your mud.
If you enjoyed the area, please do feel free to drop us a line too.
Regards,
Roger Lim  email: limyeech@iscs.nus.sg
Gerald Tan email: art31313@leonis.nus.sg
Nigel Poh

202.title: The Haunted Pine Forest
202.description:
The snow begins to fall thickly as you enter a pine forest in the
mountains.  The burnt remains of two log cabins lie in a clearing
about a dozen yards off the path.  There is a disconcerting silence
in these woods, an oppressive lifelessness that makes you want to
leave them immediately.  The trail stretches through these haunted
woods up the side of the mountain and down through the fog to the
foothills of the range.

up.description: Move further up and you'll be near the summit.

down.description: You see a fog shrouded trail.

203.title: Near the Summit
203.description:
It has become almost unbearably cold as you trek near the very summit
of the mountain.  The bare and broken trees provide no cover for you as
a cold and gusty wind whips the falling snow harshly into your face.
A pine forest covers the slopes of the mountain, while to your south
you spot a narrow mountain pass.

down.description: The Haunted Pine forest is below.

204.title: A Mountain Pass
204.description:
You are in a steep pass between mountain peaks.  It descends sharply to
the south, while heading north towards a summit.  All around you, you
see only the mountain rises and the wind-swept plateaus of these
ancient highlands.

north.description: You see the summit of the mountain.

down.description: What is this?  A secret door in the mountain?!

205.title: A Mountain Pass
205.description:
The mountains part breath-takingly to reveal a huge forest of tall and
majestic oaks.  You can walk along a mountain creek which winds west,
down the side of the mountain and into the forest, or follow the trail
you are on and continue up the mountain pass.

206.title: A Thickly-Wooded Dell
206.description:
You are in a secluded dell at the foot of a great mountain range.  Old
valley ash are crowned with the slightest hint of frost, and bushes of
flowering foxglove line the bank of a stream which runs west into a
small vale.  To the south there is a great forest of majestic oaks,
while to your east a trail that seems little-used heads into the
mountains.

west.description: The road to Clover lies to the west.

south.description: You can make out a Signpost of sort in that direction.

down.description: What is this?  A secret door in the dell?!

207.title: A Signpost in the Enchanted Forests
207.description:
Through the majestic oaks of these ancient woods, the deep earthiness of
the forest permeates your senses, while a gentle hum of magic in the air
pulses low and vibrant.  A shy nymph peeks inquisitively at you from
behind a tree before disappearing with a titter.  An old but sturdy
signpost stands beside a crossing in the paths, which lead in every
direction.

east.description: A well-used trail through the forest lies to the east.

extras.description:
The sign seems to provide directions etched in a spidery hand.
North to the Vale of Clover
South into the Emerald Forest
East to the Rangers' Lodge
West to the Witch Wood where evil lurks

208.title: A Fae Crossing
208.description:
The path has taken you to a junction over which hangs the twisted
branches of two Blackthorn trees and an Elderwood tree.  You remember
folktales which tell that spiteful faeries lurk under the meetings of
such trees to waylay and confound woodland travellers.  Feeling a little
uncomfortable, you look south, where the forest seems to darken
menacingly.  The east trail beckons you to the safety of the Emerald
Forest.

east.description: You can make out a Signpost of sort in that direction.

209.title: Road to the Vale of Clover
209.description:
You are on an old road which runs alongside a clear stream.  It leads
to the Vale of Clover, a small valley at the foot of the mountains.
Looking down the road, you see a small village nestled beside a bend
in the stream.  Tall heather blows in the wind and you see some cows
grazing idly nearby.  The road east runs down into a wooded dell.

east.description: You see a thickly wooded Dell.

210.title: In Clover
210.description:
It's quite beautiful here in the quiet village of Clover.  The air is
fresh and filled with the scent of flowers.  There are some quaintly-
appointed cottages painted in bright colors on either side of the road.
You hear ringing laughter to the east, where a country path winds up a
hillock.  The village square lies to the north.

east.description: The Green Hillock is to the East.

south.description: The road leading out of Clover is there.

211.title: A Green Hillock
211.description:
You are on a small meadow on the hillock.  This seems to be where the
folk of Clover have their picnics.  From the sound of manly crooning
accompanied by girlish titters, you deduce it also where the local lasses
receive the attentions of their suitors.  Scattered trees and trimmed
hedges provide the green with shadynooks and pivate arbors.  The
hillock continues north, while the path west will take you back to the
village.

west.description: The road to Clover is to the West.

212.title: A Secluded Corner of the Meadow
212.description:
You are in a quiet corner of the meadow, well-shaded by two large cypress
trees.  Though empty now, it seems a likely spot for young couples to
exchange professions of love, undisturbed by friends or irate parents.
Having no time for such adolescent frivolities, you quickly scan the
countryside and note that from this vantage point, you can look over the
entire village of Clover.  There is a small lightly worn path leading to
the south.

south.description: The Green Hillock is to the South.

213.title: The Village Square
213.description:
A couple of farmers are erecting a "Harvest Moon Festival" sign over
where you are standing.  A gaggle of goodwives are gossiping by the
village well while their children are chasing a playful dog.  An apple
tree lends its shade to two old men who are sharing a large tankard of
cider.  You see a large farm to the north and espy a dirt track which
leads west from the village and then turns north to a ruined abbey.

south.description: You see a path leading out of the villlage.

west.description: You see an old dirt track.

214.title: An Old Dirt Track
214.description:
You are on an old dirt track outside the village of Clover.  The path
seems little travelled, and wildflowers grow abundantly by the side of
the track.  Heading east, you will return to the village.  The dirt track
continues north for some miles.

north.description: The old dirt track continues north.

east.description: The village square is to the east.

215.title: An Old Dirt Track
215.description:
Looking north, you see a ruined monastery at the end of the track, half-
hidden by a copse of cypress trees.

north.description: You see a huge monastary ahead.

south.description: The old dirt track continues south.

216.title: Farmer Griff's Farm
216.description:
You stand in front of a gaily-painted barnhouse.  Old Griff - farmer,
freeman and entrepreneur - seems to be having a little trouble keeping
his livestock in order.  His chickens are harrying his ducks in the
duck pond, while a big brown shaggy dog is chasing his pigs around the
entire farm.  From inside a blue and yellow farmhouse you hear Princess
Yaruga, the farmer's wife, shouting angrily in a foreign tongue.

south.description: The village square is to the south.

extras.description:
Buy   <item>  - Buy an Item.
Sell  <item>  - I don't want your stuff dude!
Value <item>  - I ain't an educated chap pal!
****                       I Don't Give CREDIT                      ****

217.title: The Witch Wood
217.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

south.description: You see the entrance of witch wood to the south.

218.title: The Witch Wood
218.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

219.title: The Altar of Sacrifice
219.description:
The trees seem to hang back in fear as you walk into a wide clearing in
the witch wood.  The clearing is dominated by a broken stone altar that
is caked red and black and the blood and grime of centuries of evil.
The torches that hang from the holes of the trees ringing the clearing
throw a halflight on a deep hole in the altar.

220.title: The Witch Wood
220.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

221.title: The Witch Wood
221.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

222.title: The Witch Wood
222.description:
You are deep in the Witch Wood.  The evil that taints these woods grows
palpable here.  Directly to your north is a wall of shifting shadows that
your light cannot penetrate.  Tall reeds with thorny blades grow around
a path that leads west into the mists.  The forest lies to your east and
south.

west.description: You see a broken jetty ahead.

223.title: The Wall of Shadows
223.description:
You step into shadows and suddenly hellish voices shriek into your ears.
Your light flares brightly for an instant and you see the trees around
you writhing while they burn in black flames.  They bend their branches
into a series of glyphs and runes, forming an archway across the entrance
of a cavern to the east.  The voices stop suddenly, and you are once again
all alone in the darkness.

east.description: You make out 3 figures in the darkness ahead.

224.title: The Cavern of the Witch Sisters
224.description:
This is the abode of the Witch Sisters.  Gibbets hang from the ceiling,
scrying pools lie placid while cauldrons gurgle awfully.  From a large
rift in the ground infernal flames belch forth.  The heat in the cavern
is almost unbearable and you begin to feel yourself passing out from
the oppressive stench of brimstone.

extras.description:
A low voice from the dark beckons you gravely into the flames. You feel
compelled to plunge deep into the fiery chasm.

225.title: The Witch Wood
225.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

226.title: The Witch Wood
226.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

227.title: The Witch Wood
227.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  The forest stretches on for
miles.

228.title: The Witch Wood
228.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  To the south a fog rolls out
onto a dead marsh.

east.description: You see the entrance of witch wood to the east.

229.title: The Entrance of the Witch Wood
229.description:
Your uneasiness mounts as you walk along this haunted stretch of road.
The mist clears, and you find yourself in a nightmarish forest.  The
empty husk of a dead nymph lies at your feet, and on either side of you,
the trees look twisted and tortured into unnatural shapes.  The depths
of the forest sends up a hopeless cry to usher you into the woods that
ring the edge of Hell.

230.title: Under Dark Woods
230.description:
The path continues darkly under rows of Elder trees.  A crooked road
leads west through a tangled hedge of briars.  A mist prevents you from
looking beyond the hedge, but you sense a powerful and oppressive evil
reaching out towards you with cold and clawed fingers.  To the south,
the forest seems to lighten considerably, and you are about to leave
in that direction when a tattered parchment, flapping weakly in the
wind, falls at your feet.

north.description: A crossing of sorts lies to the north.

west.description: You see the entrance of witch wood to the west.

extras.description:
(Parchment: It is yellowed and seems savagely ripped from a tome.
"... I mouthed a prayer for my fallen brother Alandro as I raised his
morning-star to smite the foul witch who had struck him down.  But I
had reckoned without her Sisters, and the twain now flew shrieking
towards me.  The first, diabolically transformed, pinioned me to the
ground, while her corrupt breath drove the sight from my eyes and
caused boils to burst from my skin.  The other, whom I had seen to be
beautiful but terrible even as I was made blind, wrested my weapon
from me and tore at my face.  I know not how I fled from their cursed
abode, but the relief I felt then at my escape was vainly felt, for
even now, I nightly suffer the torments of their evil blandishments.
In my sleep I see myself being chased at the edge of a black abyss by
the Devil's huntsmen and their hellhounds slavering for my soul.  I
wake up drained, I feel both my faith and my sanity slipping from me.
We had been foolishly proud, thinking we could destroy those servants
of evil alone.  Now we are undone, and the relic of our Holy Saint is
lost forever.")

231.title: The Emerald Forest
231.description:
All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into
staying here forever.  Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees
while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and
green.  The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem
well-kept, yet untravelled.

232.title: The Emerald Forest
232.description:
All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into
staying here forever.  Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees
while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and
green.  The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem
well-kept, yet untravelled.

north.description: A well-used trail through the forest lies to there.

233.title: A Well-Used Trail Through The Forest
233.description:
You are on a forest trail that runs in all directions but north, where
the forest skirts the sheer mountain face.  Dew-covered hawthorn bushes
flank the east trail, along which several rangers are walking.  It seems
to be the woodkeepers' outpost.

east.description: The Woodkeepers' Outpost is to the east.

234.title: The Woodkeepers' Outpost
234.description:
Your fellow rangers hail you as you stride into this wide clearing.
Some are preparing to leave on their daily treks through the forest,
while others are tending to injured woodland animals.  The Guildmaster's
cabin lies to the north, while several smaller cabins lie to the south.
A fair-sized lodge sits beneath a Redwood tree to your east.

north.description: The Guildmaster's cabin lies to the north.

east.description: Smokey's Supplies is to the east.

south.description: A wood-keeper's cabin is to the south.

west.description: A well-used trail through the forest lies there.

235.title: The Guildmaster's Cabin
235.description:
Built from the logs of sturdy cypress trees from the Vale of Clover,
the Guildmaster's cabin has a homely feel to it.  Oaks have grown their
low branches across the roof of the cabin and any number of small forest
animals race along the length of the porch.  Elesar of the Woods is here,
instructing a young woodkeeper.

south.description: The Wood-Keepers' Outpost is to the south.

236.title: Smokey's Supplies
236.description:
You enter a lodge which sits under the shade of an ancient Redwood tree.
All manner of supplies and equipment useful to rangers and woodkeepers
are neatly stacked on shelves or stored in closets.  A parchment tacked
on a wall lists the supplies which you may purchase from Smokey, the
Ranger Bear who runs the supply store.

west.description: The Wood-Keepers' Outpost is to the west.

extras.description:
Buy   - Buy an Item. *brrrrrrr*
Sell  - Smokey needs nothing from ya!
Value - *Brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr*
*** NO HAGGLING ALLOWED ***

237.title: The Emerald Forest
237.description:
All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into
staying here forever.  Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees
while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and
green.  The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem
well-kept, yet untravelled.

238.title: In the Emerald Forest
238.description:
A circle of blue-capped mushrooms form an old faerie ring by the side
of the path you are on.  On certain nights of the year, the faerie folk
wander out into such rings for wild dances by the moonlight.  It is
said that mortals who are drawn into the dancing circle on such nights
can be held captive by faerie food or a faerie's kiss and made to dance
on and on for a period of seven years.  You hear a titter of laughter
from the branches of a tree, but when you look up you see nothing.

east.description: A great tree lies to the east.

239.title: Before the Great Tree
239.description:
You stand at the perimeter of the largest, most incredible tree that
you have ever laid eyes on.  It has gold-flecked leaves that are the
size of small horses, with thick roots supporting a massive trunk that
is easily twice the size of the grand fortress of the Templar Knights
of Renhorden.  It seems to stretch endlessly into the sky, and you
wonder why you did not see it towering above all the other trees in
the forest.  You long to inch closer, but cannot seem to move beyond
an invisible barrier that keeps you about a hundred yards away.  You
see movement and lights in and about the tree, but there seems to be
no way you can get closer to it.

south.description: A faerie hill lies to the south.

240.title: The Lost Grotto
240.description:
You follow the stream to a limpid pool where the waters lap gently
against the rocks.  Large ferns provide shade from above and the petals
of brightly-colored flowers float in the pool.  Sitting on the moss-
covered rocks by the pool is a slim young girl dressed in green.  She
has long black hair and elfin features, a yew bow slung across her back.
She seems oblivious to your presence and hums softly as she passes her
hand through the waters.

south.description: A stream flows to the south.

241.title: By a Stream
241.description:
You stand by a wide stream that flows swiftly to the north.  Drawn by
the sudden sound of musical laughter, you look over the tops of some
lilac bushes and spy a group of nymphs frolicking in the stream.  It
seems like a vision captured from some nature god's idyllic dream.  You
hear the distant roar of a waterfall to your south.

north.description: A pool forms to the north.

south.description: A waterfall glade lies to the south.

west.description: A faerie hill lies to the west.

242.title: The Waterfall Glade
242.description:
A majestic waterfall pours from high above the mountains to the south.
Great torrents of water crash down on the rocks in a wide pool, and even
where you stand in a shaded glade, the wind blows sprays of water into
your face.  A profusion of flowering shrubs grow at the edge of the
pool.  In a large shaded retreat made by the overhanging branches of
silver oak trees stands a likeness of Altariel, the Lady of the Woods.
At the base of the waterfall, a rock pool with crystal clear water has
formed.

north.description: A stream flows to the north.

243.title: In the Emerald Forest
243.description:
The path here runs around a low grassy mound.  Looking closer, you see
the smallest of windows built into the mound.  It appears this is a
faerie hill, from which the faerie Rades ride out in celebration
through the wood paths of the Emerald Forest.  The angry face of a
faerie suddenly stares out at you from the window and interrupts your
scrutiny with a string of curses.

north.description: You see a great tree there.

east.description: A stream flows to the east.

west.description: You see a three-way junction to the west.

244.title: In the Emerald Forest
244.description:
You are at a three-way junction in the middle of the woods.  Wild trumpet
creepers run along the footpaths here.  It would seem some mischievous
pixie has drawn the vines across the path with the hope of tripping
woodland travellers such as you.  You watch your step.

east.description: A faerie hill lies to the east.

245.title: The Emerald Forest
245.description:
All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into
staying here forever.  Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees
while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and
green.  The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem
well-kept, yet untravelled.

east.description: You see a three-way junction to the east.

246.title: The Only Stump in the Forest
246.description:
In this small lonely clearing is an ancient stump.  Many years ago, a
forester callously hewed down a tree here.  In retribution, Altariel,
whose sanctuary the Emerald Forest is, transformed him into a poplar
tree.  The poplar tree stands here beside the stump, its branches cut
by the rangers of the forest whenever they are in need of wood.

247.title: The Emerald Forest
247.description:
All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into
staying here forever.  Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees
while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and
green.  The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem
well-kept, yet untravelled.

248.title: The Forest Road
248.description:
You are at the head of a long north-south road in the forest.  The
Greenbrier bushes that grow beside the path have shed their heart-shaped
leaves on the road.  All is quiet here.  To the north, dark Elder trees
loom out ominously.  The road continues south.

249.title: The Dead Moors
249.description:
Everything is black here.  These bleak moorlands are where the witches
plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by
moonlight as souless pumpkin men.  The fetid marsh pools have been the
graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises
from them.

250.title: The Dead Moors
250.description:
Everything is black here.  These bleak moorlands are where the witches
plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by
moonlight as soulless pumpkin men.  The fetid marsh pools have been the
graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises
from them.

south.description: You see a hill in the marsh.

251.title: The Dead Moors
251.description:
Everything is black here.  These bleak moorlands are where the witches
plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by
moonlight as soulless pumpkin men.  The fetid marsh pools have been the
graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises
from them.

252.title: The Dead Moors
252.description:
Everything is black here.  These bleak moorlands are where the witches
plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by
moonlight as soulless pumpkin men.  The fetid marsh pools have been the
graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises
from them.

east.description: You see a hill in the marsh.

253.title: A Hill in the Marsh
253.description:
You have come upon a low hill in the marsh.  As you ascend it, you
notice that the fog that covers the rest of the fens rolls away.  The
weeds are dry at the edge of the mound and the grass that grows here is
is lush and green.  A lone oak tree stands on the mound, like a beacon of
goodness that repels the evil of the witches.

254.title: The Forest Road
254.description:
You are walking a long a north-south road in the forest.  The Greenbrier
bushes that grow beside the path have shed many heart-shaped leaves on
the road.  Two blue-breasted swallows swoop low in front of you, trilling
out a morning song.  The road continues north and south.

south.description: A trail lies to the south.

255.title: The Forest Road
255.description:
You are walking a long a north-south road in the forest.  The Greenbrier
bushes that grow beside the path have shed many heart-shaped leaves on
the road.  Two blue-breasted swallows swoop low in front of you, trilling
out a morning song.  The road continues north and south.

256.title: A Trail
256.description:
Pausing a moment from your travels through the Emerald forest,
you hear the gurgling sound of moving water coming from the east,
while to the south the forest continues on with oak, pine and
rosewood. Peering intently toward the source of the sound, you
notice a faint outline of a bridge resting in the shade of the long
leafy branches of the tall, flanking trees.

south.description: A woodland trail lies to the south.

257.title: A Shady Bridge
257.description:
You stand on the western end of a wooden bridge in the Emerald Forest.
Its origin is a mystery, but the fine detail and craftsmanship it bears
would rival even the most cunning of woodsmiths.  The branches of the
tall trees that grow on the banks of the stream cover the bridge in a
soft cool embrace while a breeze flows in from the north.  Huge salmon
and rainbow trout weave their way amongst the rocks in the stream below.
To the west the forest stretches on, while the sounds of laughter and
play drift in softly from the south.

258.title: The Shady bridge
258.description:
You stand on the eastern end of a finely crafted wooden bridge. Its
edges have small engraved runes carved into them, and the wood
is probably a form of pine or oak from the Emerald Forest itself.
Lacking the dull weathered tone and creaking of most wooden
bridges, it spans across a fairly wide river flowing in a north-south
direction. The height of the surrounding trees provide a pleasant
shade from the noon-day sun.

259.title: A Woodland Trail
259.description:
You are following a small woodland trail in the Emerald Forest. The
hear the sound of moving water to the west, and squinting a bit
intently you see a blurred outline of a small wooden bridge in the
distance. Who built that bridge? And why? Only a few seasoned rangers
have ever come this deep into the enchanted wood, and none ever
mentioned the existence of construction of a bridge. As far as you
know, the forest has resisted gently but firmly all attempts at
colonisation or lumbering, which makes it quite a curiousity.

west.description: A shady bridge lies to the west.

east.description: A dense path lies to the east.

260.title: A Dense Path
260.description:
You are walking deep in the Emerald Forest. The protective canopy of
the tall rosewood trees offer a welcomed protection against the sun's
rays as well as providing a home for thousands of living things, some of
whom chirp, sing or buzz their existence for all to know, while others
remain silent, at least to your ears while the aroma of fresh woodland
flowers fill the air.

west.description: You see a woodland trail there.

south.description: A clearing opens to the south.

261.title: A Woodland Trail
261.description:
You are following a small woodland trail in the Emerald Forest.  Off in
the distance to the east, you hear the sound of a roaring waterfall.
The trail continues to the north and south.

north.description: A faerie hill lies to the north.

south.description: A dense path is to the south.

262.title: In the Emerald Forest
262.description:
You are walking deep in the Emerald Forest.  The tall oak trees all
around you offer welcome shade and provide homes for innumerable
woodland creatures.  You spot a brown squirrel darting away from the
bole of a tree in an industrious search for more nuts and berries.
The paths lead north, south and west.

north.description: A three-way junction lies to the north.

south.description: A woodland trail is to the south.

263.title: The Emerald Forest Choir
263.description:
Pushing aside a tangle of falling vines, you find yourself on a trail
deep in an unexplored area of the Emerald Forest.  Passage to the north
and south are blocked by clustered thickets of sagebrush and rosemary.
The cheerful croaking of a tree-frog catches your eat, accompanied by
the soprano trill of a swallow and an acapella team of bush insects.
The trail allows travel to the east and west.

west.description: A woody copse is to the west.

264.title: A Woody Copse
264.description:
You've stumbled into a small woody copse.  The trees here have grown
close and their curtains of vines obscure the view in any direction.
The fresh scent of wild thicket flowers hang in the air, the source of
which cannot be found.  A small green carpet lies in the middle of a
clearing, leading you to believe you've happened across someone's
quiet time area.

265.title: The Tree House
265.description:
This is a small platform with four walls and a leaf roof rather than
a proper tree house.  Nevertheless, it is very cosy and could accommodate
two quite comfortably.  A pot of jasmine tea is simmering over a fire
and a few plush cushions are scattered on a rug in one corner.  On a
shelf on the west wall are the complete works of Shakespeare, while
another book lies half-read on the floor.

266.title: A Small Clearing
266.description:
You stand in a small clearing deep in the Emerald Forest. The ground
shows no evidence of trees being cut down or any other indication
that the clearing is carved from axe or hand, yet the borders seem too
neat to be the result of Mother Nature's whim. In some areas the
shrubs and bushes appear to have gone out of their way (if that is
possible) to align themselves, and the soft wood grass while not having
the blunt heads of a kept garden seem to be growing neatly in line all
by themselves. Strong magic is at work here.

267.title: The Ragged Trail
267.description:
You stand on a ragged forest trail with passage leading in all four
directions. The pathways to the north, south and east lead deeper
into the woods, while a winding trail west seems to end in a small
clearing. From where you stand you can see small movement and
curious sound which you can't quite make out. The tree branches
sway softly while you decide your next course.

south.description: You see the south-easterly end of the forest.

west.description: You see a bunch of pixies and brownies in a game.

268.title: The Honey Bun
268.description:
Two lines of pixies and brownies stand facing one another yelling
and hooting in excitement. They seem to be deep in a game of
'Pixie, Brownie and Honey Bun'. A small bag filled with pipeweed
seed is placed squarely in the middle of the line, while both teams
are numbered off. A number is called, and the respective brownie
or pixie has to run forward, grab the bag and return to the line
without being touched. Looks like great fun.

east.description: A ragged trail lies to the east.

south.description: The south-east end of the Bonanza is there.

west.description: You see a fairly large clearing to the west.

269.title: A fairly large clearing
269.description:
There is an incredible sight before you! Dozens and dozens of
green clad pixies and oak brown dressed brownies are milling
around in a fairly large clearing, which stretches on to the east and
south. Little temporary stalls have been set up, selling a wide
variety of enchanting desserts, cream puffs and wonderful potions.
The grand Pixie-Brownie Bonanza Festival seems up in force, and
there are no signs of it ending in the near future...

east.description: You see a bunch of pixies and brownies in a game.

west.description: You see a three way woodland ahead.

south.description: The south-west end of the pixie bonanza is there.

270.title: The three way woodland
270.description:
You stand at the middling spot of a three way woodland trail deep
in the Emerald Forest. There are clear passages to the north, west
and east, while the path to the south abruptly ends at the foot of a
sheer cliff face, with a wall so smooth that it would be impossible
to climb. A variety of bird song and animal sound fill the air.

east.description: You see a fairly large clearing to the east.

west.description: A forest trail lies to the west.

271.title: A Forest Trail
271.description:
The somewhat ragged west-ward forest trail makes a sharp right and
southernly turn here, making further travel to the west difficult
if not impossible, would be safer to backtrack and find another
path instead of hacking through the notoriously resilient trees of the
Emerald Forest. A tall tree with huge leafy branches branches stands
here tempting you to take a break and rest in its shade.

north.description: A tall tree with huge leafy branches blocks your way.

east.description: You see a three way woodland to the east.

272.title: A Dwindling Forest Path
272.description:
The forest path begins to dwindle here.  It's obvious you've entered
a part of the forest seldom visited by anyone.  You notice the richness
of the flora here, with a wider and thicker range of herbs growing in
wild abandon across the ground or in small cul-de-sacs formed at the
roots of the oak trees.  You hear a rustle in the bushes, but staring
intently without trying to look too obvious, you notice nothing.

south.description: You see a small tombstone to the south.

west.description: You see a rainbow to the west.

273.title: A Lovely Trail
273.description:
You are following a faint north-south trail in the Emerald Forest.
Swallows and Bluebirds fill the air with song and laughter, and you
spy a small red-breast Robin sitting motionless on a branch on one of
the oak trees. The serenity of this forest is amazing, you feel at
peace and safe, as though you just stepped into a fairy tale where
the knights kill all the trolls, and nobody stays hungry. It's hard
not to day dream, walking here.

north.description: A Forest trail lies to the north.

west.description: A forest path lies to the west.

274.title: The Tombstone
274.description:
There is something rather peculiar about this part of the Emerald
Forest. A small tombstone sits in the middle of a small clearing.
Carved from a white substance, its shiny surface reflects what
little sunlight that manages to escape from the umbrella covering
of trees surrounding the grave. Freshly picked flowers lie at the
foot of the tombstone, while strange symbols are lovingly engraved
on it. The strange thing is there are no paths leading from or to the
area, which would puzzle even the most observant elf or ranger. Who
would pick flowers for a lone grave and leave no evidence of passing?

extras.description:
Etched on the well-dusted tombstone are the following words...
In loving
memory
of my
beloved Bella..
DD.

275.title: The Wood-Path
275.description:
The Wood-path you're following gets more pronounced and used here,
a testimony that the Emerald Forest isn't populated (or at least
explored and travelled) only by its original furry or buzzing citizens.
Multi-coloured flowers dance gaily in the wind while clinging to the feet
of the tall oak and pine trees flanking the forest road. Flying
squirrels leap from branch to branch, probably searching for a
delicious cashew or two.

276.title: Woodkeeper's Clearing
276.description:
The path ends in a medium sized clearing. A small wooden sign states
quite dogmatically "WoodKeeper's Clearing. Forest haters not welcomed.
Orcs, Bugbears and Goblins keep out!". A number of elves and humans
dressed in a mixture of green and brown stand around here engaging in
friendly conversation. The actual Keeper's Meet hasn't started yet,
apparently there are rangers from distant woodlands still trying to
make it for the meeting. A pile of scrolls sit on a small table,
probably pamphlets to be distributed to the arriving participants of
the meeting.

east.description: Some green vines lies to the east.

277.title: The Green Vines
277.description:
Thick green vines form an impossible barrier to the south. There is
no reason to doubt that these vines possess the same ability to
block even the most determined machete-armed lumber-dwarf than all
the others. What does seem a bit strange, however, are faint footsteps
leading up to the vines and abruptly stopping. Could they merely be
tracks from an age past, now lost to the world and found only in time
and memory? Before the green vines is a mound, at the end of which you
see a sword hilt sticking up (the blade fast in the ground). The hilt
glows, and what little bit of the blade is visible between hilt and
ground seems to be flickering with brilliant flames.

north.description: You see a grove in the forest.

east.description: The border of the forest lies east.

extras.description:
Although the flickering flames do not lick at the hilt itself,
they do make it such that the hilt is visible day and night.
A shadowy small writing seems to be burnt into the hilt.

Phesephis, Warlord of the Crusades   Year 192
His strength will be missed. He was a good man.

278.title: The Silent Grove
278.description:
You've managed to wander into a small silent grove in the forest.
For some strange reason most of the forest noises seem to have
disappeared, though you can feel the rustle of the leaves beneath
your feet as you walk. The silence isn't really eerie, however, but
more of a contemplative quietness. Small stones are arranged in an odd
fashion on the ground, much the way seating chairs would be arranged
should the speaker be in the middle of a circle. It's almost as though
a little tribe of beavers just had a river-dam guild meeting and have
left for lunch.

south.description: You see thick green vines in the yonder.

279.title: The Southern border
279.description:
You are skirting the southern border of the Emerald Forest. A sheer
mountain face blocks any further exploring to the south and east,
while the forest streches on to the north and to the west. A fallen
log lies here, softing morning due and rain spray clinging to its
sparkling bark. No rotting scent seems to come from it as most
logs would emit.

west.description: You see thick green vines in the yonder.

280.title: The Wood Area
280.description:
The trail leading south from here starts sloping downward into a
richer wood area. The undisturbed nature of the flora suggests that
this is a rarely travelled part of the forest even by its own
standards. A small mouse-deer runs across the trail, followed by
a lazy looking lynx. To the north you can just make out a clearing
through the trees, and there seems to be movement.

east.description: A clearing is to the east.

south.description: You see the southern border of the forest.

281.title: The Bonanza
281.description:
Standing here at the south-west end of the Brownie-Pixie Bonanza
Festival, your senses are quickly overloaded with sight, sound
and smell. Brownies clad in soft brown cloth with little feathered
hats mingle happily with their slightly smaller and greener cousins,
the forest pixies. An almost musical chitter-chatter fills the
air, while the aroma of freshly baked treats drift in from the
north. There seems to be a forest dweller's competition, what
with the many games the pixies and brownies seem to be playing. A tug
of war is currently in progress, with the heaving Brownies having
a slight lead over the grunting Pixies.

north.description: You see a fairly large clearing.

east.description: The south-east end of the Bonanza is there.

extras.description:
Buy   - Buy an Item.
Order your flowers fast!

282.title: In a Myrtle Shade
282.description:
You are in a clearing ringed by mulberry bushes.  You hear racuous
shouts of festivity coming from the north where the Brownie-Pixie
Bonanza is in full swing.  In the centre of the clearing is an old
Myrtle tree, under the shade of which some revellers have taken to
rest.  A lone thrush sighs from a branch of the tree.  To the west
a trail slopes gently down.

north.description: The south-east end of the Bonanza is there.

283.title: The Bonanza
283.description:
You are standing at the south-east end of the Brownie-Pixie Bonanza
Festival. A major element of the celebration involves the grand
feasting of the Great Pie of Friendship. A great huge pumpkin pie
the size of farmer's cart stands proudly on a stone table with a white
tablecloth amidst a bodyguard regiment of apples, peaches, raspberries
and cookies. The dozens of eager eaters seem a bit impatient,
apparently this year's Bonanza Chairman (or Grand Pooh-ba) hasn't
opened the ceremony yet.

north.description: You see a bunch of pixies and brownies in a game of Honey Bun.

east.description: You see the South-easterly end of the forest.

south.description: A clearing is to the south.

west.description: The south-west end of the Bonanza is there.

284.title: South-easterly end of the forest
284.description:
You stand at the southern most end of the Emerald Forest. The path
continues on north, while to the west appears to be a large clearing
with sounds of laughter and conversation drifting in with the breeze.
There is a sheer drop to the south, while mountains stretch on as far
as your eyes can see. The terrain belows seems mostly rock and stone
and has spare vegetation. You can just make out a small path heading
roughly to the east through a cluster of bushes and trees.

285.title: Within a garden
285.description:
You've managed to stumble into an oriental home. A small wooden hut
sits to the south of a garden lovingly nurtured with blooming yellow,
white and red flower blossoms. Two stone lions sit on wooden pillars
guarding entrance to the garden, while two jade dragons guard the door
to the hut proper. A small bucket pulled well stands next to a pen of
chickens and ducks who cluck and quack away merrily. Carrots, cabbages
and rice are grown in a medium sized plot of land to the north. There
is a small rock pool to the east.

west.description: You see the southern end of the forest.

286.title: A peaceful rock pool
286.description:
You've entered a very peaceful part of the mystic's home. A crystal clear
pool sits here with large smooth pebbles neatly arranged all around its
circumference. Peering into the pool, the unmoving mirror like surface of
the water reflect your image. There is no way of knowing exactly how deep
the pool is, but it must be very deep since you can't see the bottom. There
is a small wooden bench here beckoning you to sit and rest for a while,
and ponder things you've put aside, and think on matters you've forgotten.

287.title: Yun Fei Yang's humble abode
287.description:
You stand in the living room of a small wooden hut. A small partitioned
kitchen is to the south of here. The spartan furniture, tidiness and
simple basic furniture hint at the occupier's character. There is a
beautiful painting of a young oriental woman dressed in long flowing
silk on one of the walls. Parchments with foreign exotic wordings in
flowing black ink script sit on a desk. A small book catches your eye,
its title being "Zhuge Liang's Chinese-Theran Dictionary". Some of
the scrolls here are written in a language you can understand.

extras.description:
As you flip open the dictionary, it falls open to a well-read page...
Tian            -> Heavenly sky
Can             -> Mystical web
Shen            -> Special
Gong            -> Force
Ni              -> You
Wo              -> Me
Gan             -> Dare
Dou             -> Fight
Kan             -> See
Si              -> Die
Gou             -> Dog
Yan Se          -> Colour
Qi Dao          -> Pray
Jiu Ming        -> Help!
Pang Pai        -> Clan
Jing Cha        -> ?
Ruan Dang       -> ?
Tan Dang        -> ?
Shen Shi        -> ?
Zhan Shi        -> ?
Yong Shi        -> ?
Shen Xian       -> Immortal
Fa Lao Sao      -> Whining
-*-

288.title: The Ruined Monastery
288.description:
Tangled vines of ivy hang down from what remains of the arch-entranced
of this small monastery.  It is ruined beyond repair and seems to have
been abandoned many years ago.  There is a quiet and melancholic silence
in the air.  You notice footprints in the dust that lead west into a
leaf-strewn courtyard and continue into a small chapel.  You notice for
the first time that that area of the monastery seems to have been spared
the dereliction that the rest of the monastery has fallen into.

south.description: The old dirt track continues south.

289.title: The Chapel of Saint Sebastian
289.description:
You stand within the only standing structure of the once proud Monastery.
Evidently the chapel is looked after for the floors are swept, pews wiped
and the stained-glass windows in good working order. A modest pulpit
made of mahogany with a carved pine cross attached to it faces a few rows
of wooden benches. Probably cared for by questing paladins or clerics
on a pilgrimage, you wonder if any of the faithful might be nearby. To
the west wall you see a hole large enough for you to squeeze through.

east.description: You see a huge monastary there.

west.description: You see a knight in the distance.

290.title: Outside the Wall of the Monastery
290.description:
You stand in a small clearing outside the west wall of a small
chapel within a monastery. Birdsong fills the air while butterflies
yellow and red flutter about happily. A tall large oak brings shade
further west, but all movement to the north and south is prevented by a
combination of trees and the old stone walls of the monastery. There
is a serenity and a sense of life and peace, hinting that it is often
used by others as a place of worship or contemplation.

east.description: You see a chapel in the distance.

291.title: The Dead Moors
291.description:
Everything is black here.  These bleak moorlands are where the witches
plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by
moonlight as soulless pumpkin men.  The fetid marsh pools have been the
graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises
from them.

292.title: The Dead Moors
292.description:
Everything is black here.  The fogs rolls into the edge of the woods to
the north, while in every other direction the desolate marshes darken
your spirits.  Small creatures are feeding on each other at your feet,
while others are clawing their way to the surface of the mud.  A sudden
wind blows the fog away, and you see a small lake through the tall reeds
to the west.

293.title: The Dead Moors
293.description:
Everything is black here.  The fog rolls into the edge of the woods to
the north, while in every other direction the desolate marshes darken
your spirits.  Small creatures are feeding on each other at your feet,
while others are clawing their way to the surface of the mud.

294.title: The Witch Wood
294.description:
You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters.  Ghost lights flicker
palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting
plants and animals that cover the forest floor.  The twisted thorn trees
groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems
to taunt you from the cover of darkness.  To the south a fog rolls out
onto a dead marsh.

295.title: A Broken Jetty
295.description:
You are at the head of a broken jetty, feeling the rotted timbers give
way beneath your feet.  The end of the jetty, which has long since
collapsed, stands over a dark still lake.  You look over the deep black
waters and see lights on the shore of an island hidden in the mists.

296.title: A Woodkeeper's Cabin
296.description:
You walk into the first cabin you see.  It is simply but comfortably
furnished.  There are four beds in the cabin, where the woodkeepers of
the Forest may rest after their patrols.  There is a small chest by the
foot of the bed.

north.description: The Wood-Keepers' Outpost is to the north.

297.title: Inside the mountain
297.description:
You walk into a large enclosure with words of many languages carved into
the walls.  A motley assortment of rugs is splayed haphazardly on the
floor.  Rusted pots with oak saplings sit on the rugs.  Mismatched
furnitures line the walls.  The sound of crackling fire comes from the
west through an iron door that is slightly ajar.
Someone with bad taste obviously lives here.

west.description: An iron door blocks the way.

up.description: A secret door leads out of the mountain.

299.title: The Mountain Forge
299.description:
Heat blasts you from a furnace built neatly into the north wall.  Above
the furnace hangs a set of iron plates, hammered into different faces of
dwarves.  You recognize the name 'Kortho' under one face plate.  The
rest of the room includes an anvil, a rack with a set of hammers and
tongs, and other tools necessary for forging.  The entire layout is a
bit more primitive than one would expect from a dwarf.  An iron door
opens the way to the east.

east.description: An iron door opens the way to the east.

up.description: A secret door provides egress from the mountain.
